Authors: Tumar, Barus J., Julius B., Jubaedah S., Buana C.
Title: Mobile-Based Prototype Design Model for Rescuing, Protecting and Consulting of Violence Victims on Women
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tumar, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Barus, J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Julius, B., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Jubaedah, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Buana, C., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Violence is still a big problem in Indonesia, especially for women. Violence can occur anywhere and everywhere its disturb the public and make the others worry. Despite the big problem of violence against women, the lack of solution and protection make it worse. This research objective was to present a solution for a better protection. This research is conducted by using data collection method through literature study and interview, also Object-Oriented Analysis and Design (OOAD). This analysis based on increasing number violence each year especially against women. So, by analysis and designing this application can help victim of violence by conducting rescue, protection and consultation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: mobile application; OOAD; violence victims on women
Index Keywords: Information management; Data collection method; Literature studies; Mobile applications; Object oriented analysis and design; OOAD; Prototype designs; Research objectives; violence victims on women; Object oriented programming
